channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6

item.title: CVE-2024-0564|2024-10-16T14:58:53.807Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's memory deduplication mechanism. The max page sharing of Kernel Samepage Merging (KSM), added in Linux kernel version 4.4.0-96.119, can create a side channel. When the attacker and the victim share the same host and the default setting of KSM is "max page sharing=256", it is possible for the attacker to time the unmap to merge with the victim's page. The unmapping time depends on whether it merges with the victim's page and additional physical pages are created beyond the KSM's "max page share". Through these operations, the attacker can leak the victim's page.

item.title: CVE-2024-8354|2024-10-11T22:03:23.165Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in QEMU. An assertion failure was present in the usb_ep_get() function in hw/net/core.c when trying to get the USB endpoint from a USB device. This flaw may allow a malicious unprivileged guest user to crash the QEMU process on the host and cause a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2024-8354|2024-10-01T12:48:32.872Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in QEMU. An assertion failure was present in the usb_ep_get() function in hw/net/core.c when trying to get the USB endpoint from a USB device. This flaw may allow a malicious unprivileged guest user to crash the QEMU process on the host and cause a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2023-39329|2024-09-30T21:09:01.532Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG. A resource exhaustion can occur in the opj_t1_decode_cblks function in tcd.c through a crafted image file, causing a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6505|2024-09-27T11:42:12.632Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the virtio-net device in QEMU. When enabling the RSS feature on the virtio-net network card, the indirections_table data within RSS becomes controllable. Setting excessively large values may cause an index out-of-bounds issue, potentially resulting in heap overflow access. This flaw allows a privileged user in the guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-8235|2024-09-25T19:11:16.397Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libvirt. A refactor of the code fetching the list of interfaces for multiple APIs introduced a corner case on platforms where allocating 0 bytes of memory results in a NULL pointer. This corner case would lead to a NULL-pointer dereference and subsequent crash of virtinterfaced. This issue could allow clients connecting to the read-only socket to crash the virtinterfaced daemon.

item.title: CVE-2024-8354|2024-09-25T17:35:10.399Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in QEMU. An assertion failure was present in the usb_ep_get() function in hw/net/core.c when trying to get the USB endpoint from a USB device. This flaw may allow a malicious unprivileged guest user to crash the QEMU process on the host and cause a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2023-39328|2024-09-23T21:28:52.718Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in OpenJPEG similar to CVE-2019-6988. This flaw allows an attacker to bypass existing protections and cause an application crash through a maliciously crafted file.

item.title: CVE-2023-39327|2024-09-23T12:36:22.619Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG. Maliciously constructed pictures can cause the program to enter a large loop and continuously print warning messages on the terminal.

item.title: CVE-2024-8612|2024-09-20T17:50:21.635Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in QEMU, in the virtio-scsi, virtio-blk, and virtio-crypto devices. The size for virtqueue_push as set in virtio_scsi_complete_req / virtio_blk_req_complete / virito_crypto_req_complete could be larger than the true size of the data which has been sent to guest. Once virtqueue_push() finally calls dma_memory_unmap to ummap the in_iov, it may call the address_space_write function to write back the data. Some uninitialized data may exist in the bounce.buffer, leading to an information leak.

item.title: CVE-2024-8354|2024-09-19T10:45:06.191Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in QEMU. An assertion failure was present in the usb_ep_get() function in hw/net/core.c when trying to get the USB endpoint from a USB device. This flaw may allow a malicious unprivileged guest user to crash the QEMU process on the host and cause a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2024-45770|2024-09-19T08:45:37.303Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in Performance Co-Pilot (PCP). This flaw can only be exploited if an attacker has access to a compromised PCP system account. The issue is related to the pmpost tool, which is used to log messages in the system. Under certain conditions, it runs with high-level privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-45769|2024-09-19T08:45:06.247Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in Performance Co-Pilot (PCP).Â This flaw allows an attacker to send specially crafted data to the system, which could cause the program to misbehave or crash.

item.title: CVE-2024-2467|2024-09-18T15:58:16.449Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A timing-based side-channel flaw exists in the perl-Crypt-OpenSSL-RSA package, which could be sufficient to recover plaintext across a network in a Bleichenbacher-style attack. To achieve successful decryption, an attacker would have to be able to send a large number of trial messages. The vulnerability affects the legacy PKCS#1v1.5 RSA encryption padding mode.

item.title: CVE-2024-8235|2024-09-13T21:22:34.490Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libvirt. A refactor of the code fetching the list of interfaces for multiple APIs introduced a corner case on platforms where allocating 0 bytes of memory results in a NULL pointer. This corner case would lead to a NULL-pointer dereference and subsequent crash of virtinterfaced. This issue could allow clients connecting to the read-only socket to crash the virtinterfaced daemon.

item.title: CVE-2024-6505|2024-09-13T21:22:06.696Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the virtio-net device in QEMU. When enabling the RSS feature on the virtio-net network card, the indirections_table data within RSS becomes controllable. Setting excessively large values may cause an index out-of-bounds issue, potentially resulting in heap overflow access. This flaw allows a privileged user in the guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-7409|2024-09-13T21:22:20.386Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU NBD Server. This vulnerability allows a denial of service (DoS) attack via improper synchronization during socket closure when a client keeps a socket open as the server is taken offline.

item.title: CVE-2024-4693|2024-09-13T21:21:57.223Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU Virtio PCI Bindings (hw/virtio/virtio-pci.c). An improper release and use of the irqfd for vector 0 during the boot process leads to a guest triggerable crash via vhost_net_stop(). This flaw allows a malicious guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-6655|2024-09-10T05:11:24.158Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the GTK library. Under certain conditions, it is possible for a library to be injected into a GTK application from the current working directory.

item.title: CVE-2024-6505|2024-09-09T21:13:31.229Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the virtio-net device in QEMU. When enabling the RSS feature on the virtio-net network card, the indirections_table data within RSS becomes controllable. Setting excessively large values may cause an index out-of-bounds issue, potentially resulting in heap overflow access. This flaw allows a privileged user in the guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-6655|2024-09-09T17:02:46.907Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the GTK library. Under certain conditions, it is possible for a library to be injected into a GTK application from the current working directory.

item.title: CVE-2024-7006|2024-09-03T13:44:48.347Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A null pointer dereference flaw was found in Libtiff via `tif_dirinfo.c`. This issue may allow an attacker to trigger memory allocation failures through certain means, such as restricting the heap space size or injecting faults, causing a segmentation fault. This can cause an application crash, eventually leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-8235|2024-08-30T16:16:57.214Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libvirt. A refactor of the code fetching the list of interfaces for multiple APIs introduced a corner case on platforms where allocating 0 bytes of memory results in a NULL pointer. This corner case would lead to a NULL-pointer dereference and subsequent crash of virtinterfaced. This issue could allow clients connecting to the read-only socket to crash the virtinterfaced daemon.

item.title: CVE-2024-4693|2024-08-28T15:02:50.339Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU Virtio PCI Bindings (hw/virtio/virtio-pci.c). An improper release and use of the irqfd for vector 0 during the boot process leads to a guest triggerable crash via vhost_net_stop(). This flaw allows a malicious guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-7409|2024-08-21T06:12:20.016Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU NBD Server. This vulnerability allows a denial of service (DoS) attack via improper synchronization during socket closure when a client keeps a socket open as the server is taken offline.

item.title: CVE-2024-2467|2024-08-20T16:50:13.901Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A timing-based side-channel flaw exists in the perl-Crypt-OpenSSL-RSA package, which could be sufficient to recover plaintext across a network in a Bleichenbacher-style attack. To achieve successful decryption, an attacker would have to be able to send a large number of trial messages. The vulnerability affects the legacy PKCS#1v1.5 RSA encryption padding mode.

item.title: CVE-2024-43168|2024-08-19T16:59:40.785Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A heap-buffer-overflow flaw was found in the cfg_mark_ports function within Unbound's config_file.c, which can lead to memory corruption. This issue could allow an attacker with local access to provide specially crafted input, potentially causing the application to crash or allowing arbitrary code execution. This could result in a denial of service or unauthorized actions on the system.

item.title: CVE-2024-43167|2024-08-19T16:59:38.739Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the ub_ctx_set_fwd function in Unbound. This issue could allow an attacker who can invoke specific sequences of API calls to cause a segmentation fault. When certain API functions such as ub_ctx_set_fwd and ub_ctx_resolvconf are called in a particular order, the program attempts to read from a NULL pointer, leading to a crash. This issue can result in a denial of service by causing the application to terminate unexpectedly.

item.title: CVE-2024-43167|2024-08-16T20:02:53.862Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the ub_ctx_set_fwd function in Unbound. This issue could allow an attacker who can invoke specific sequences of API calls to cause a segmentation fault. When certain API functions such as ub_ctx_set_fwd and ub_ctx_resolvconf are called in a particular order, the program attempts to read from a NULL pointer, leading to a crash. This issue can result in a denial of service by causing the application to terminate unexpectedly.

item.description: A flaw was found in the libtiff library. An out-of-memory issue in the TIFFReadEncodedStrip function can be triggered when processing a crafted TIFF file, allowing attackers to perform memory allocation of arbitrary sizes, resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6501|2024-08-02T16:18:33.793Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in NetworkManager. When a system running NetworkManager with DEBUG logs enabled and an interface eth1 configured with LLDP enabled, a malicious user could inject a malformed LLDP packet. NetworkManager would crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6716|2024-08-02T16:19:29.980Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the libtiff library. An out-of-memory issue in the TIFFReadEncodedStrip function can be triggered when processing a crafted TIFF file, allowing attackers to perform memory allocation of arbitrary sizes, resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6239|2024-08-02T16:18:20.046Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the Poppler's Pdfinfo utility. This issue occurs when using -dests parameter with pdfinfo utility. By using certain malformed input files, an attacker could cause the utility to crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6655|2024-08-02T16:19:29.178Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the GTK library. Under certain conditions, it is possible for a library to be injected into a GTK application from the current working directory.

item.title: CVE-2024-5742|2024-08-02T16:17:11.796Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in GNU Nano that allows a possible privilege escalation through an insecure temporary file. If Nano is killed while editing, a file it saves to an emergency file with the permissions of the running user provides a window of opportunity for attackers to escalate privileges through a malicious symlink.

item.title: CVE-2024-6716|2024-07-16T16:29:07.753Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libtiff. This flaw allows an attacker to create a crafted tiff file, forcing libtiff to allocate memory indefinitely. This issue can result in a denial of service of the system consuming libtiff due to memory starvation.

item.title: CVE-2024-6716|2024-07-16T14:45:38.808Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libtiff. This flaw allows an attacker to create a crafted tiff file, forcing libtiff to allocate memory indefinitely. This issue can result in a denial of service of the system consuming libtiff due to memory starvation.

item.description: A flaw was found in NetworkManager. When a system running NetworkManager with DEBUG logs enabled and an interface eth1 configured with LLDP enabled, a malicious user could inject a malformed LLDP packet. NetworkManager would crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6409|2024-07-09T14:52:16.363Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition vulnerability was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd) in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9, where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog(). This issue leaves it vulnerable to a signal handler race condition on the cleanup_exit() function, which introduces the same vulnerability as CVE-2024-6387 in the unprivileged child of the SSHD server. As a consequence of a successful attack, in the worst case scenario, the attacker may be able to perform a remote code execution (RCE) within unprivileged user running the sshd server. This vulnerability affects only the sshd server shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9, while upstream versions of sshd are not impact by this flaw.

item.title: CVE-2024-6409|2024-07-08T17:57:10.517Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition vulnerability was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog(). This issue leaves it vulnerable to a signal handler race condition on the cleanup_exit() function, which introduces the same vulnerability as CVE-2024-6387 in the unprivileged child of the SSHD server.

item.title: CVE-2024-6505|2024-07-08T17:41:58.503Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the virtio-net device in QEMU. When enabling the RSS feature on the virtio-net network card, the indirections_table data within RSS becomes controllable. Setting excessively large values may cause an index out-of-bounds issue, potentially resulting in heap overflow access. This flaw allows a privileged user in the guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-6387|2024-07-02T22:46:23.901Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A security regression (CVE-2006-5051) was discovered in OpenSSH's server (sshd). There is a race condition which can lead to sshd to handle some signals in an unsafe manner. An unauthenticated, remote attacker may be able to trigger it by failing to authenticate within a set time period.

item.title: CVE-2024-4467|2024-07-02T18:05:57.843Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU disk image utility (qemu-img) 'info' command. A specially crafted image file containing a `json:{}` value describing block devices in QMP could cause the qemu-img process on the host to consume large amounts of memory or CPU time, leading to denial of service or read/write to an existing external file.

item.title: CVE-2024-6387|2024-07-02T18:49:50.696Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

item.title: CVE-2024-6387|2024-07-02T13:18:46.662Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

item.title: CVE-2024-6387|2024-07-01T19:22:06.182Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

item.title: CVE-2024-6387|2024-07-01T16:53:55.830Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

item.title: CVE-2024-6387|2024-07-01T12:37:25.431Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

item.title: CVE-2024-6239|2024-06-24T19:29:02.165Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the Poppler's Pdfinfo utility. This issue occurs when using -dests parameter with pdfinfo utility. By using certain malformed input files, an attacker could cause the utility to crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6239|2024-06-24T07:26:26.260Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the Poppler's Pdfinfo utility. This issue occurs when using -dests parameter with pdfinfo utility. By using certain malformed input files, an attacker could cause the utility to crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-4693|2024-06-04T17:56:38.174Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU Virtio PCI Bindings (hw/virtio/virtio-pci.c). An improper release and use of the irqfd for vector 0 during the boot process leads to a guest triggerable crash via vhost_net_stop(). This flaw allows a malicious guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-4418|2024-05-08T03:03:05.135Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A race condition leading to a stack use-after-free flaw was found in libvirt. Due to a bad assumption in the virNetClientIOEventLoop() method, the `data` pointer to a stack-allocated virNetClientIOEventData structure ended up being used in the virNetClientIOEventFD callback while the data pointer's stack frame was concurrently being "freed" when returning from virNetClientIOEventLoop(). The 'virtproxyd' daemon can be used to trigger requests. If libvirt is configured with fine-grained access control, this issue, in theory, allows a user to escape their otherwise limited access. This flaw allows a local, unprivileged user to access virtproxyd without authenticating. Remote users would need to authenticate before they could access it.

item.title: CVE-2024-2467|2024-04-25T16:45:02.948Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A timing-based side-channel flaw exists in the perl-Crypt-OpenSSL-RSA package, which could be sufficient to recover plaintext across a network in a Bleichenbacher-style attack. To achieve successful decryption, an attacker would have to be able to send a large number of trial messages. The vulnerability affects the legacy PKCS#1v1.5 RSA encryption padding mode.

item.title: CVE-2024-5742|2024-06-12T08:53:02.256Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in GNU Nano that allows a possible privilege escalation through an insecure temporary file. If Nano is killed while editing, a file it saves to an emergency file with the permissions of the running user provides a window of opportunity for attackers to escalate privileges through a malicious symlink.

item.title: CVE-2024-6239|2024-06-21T13:28:23.857Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the Poppler's Pdfinfo utility. This issue occurs when using -dests parameter with pdfinfo utility. By using certain malformed input files, an attacker could cause the utility to crash, leading to a denial of service.

However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

item.title: CVE-2024-6505|2024-07-05T13:51:38.241Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the virtio-net device in QEMU. When enabling the RSS feature on the virtio-net network card, the indirections_table data within RSS becomes controllable. Setting excessively large values may cause an index out-of-bounds issue, potentially resulting in heap overflow access. This flaw allows a privileged user in the guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-6505|2024-07-08T15:42:11.195Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the virtio-net device in QEMU. When enabling the RSS feature on the virtio-net network card, the indirections_table data within RSS becomes controllable. Setting excessively large values may cause an index out-of-bounds issue, potentially resulting in heap overflow access. This flaw allows a privileged user in the guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-6409|2024-07-08T18:22:21.964Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition vulnerability was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog(). This issue leaves it vulnerable to a signal handler race condition on the cleanup_exit() function, which introduces the same vulnerability as CVE-2024-6387 in the unprivileged child of the SSHD server.

item.title: CVE-2023-39328|2024-07-09T13:53:07.111Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in OpenJPEG similar to CVE-2019-6988. This flaw allows an attacker to bypass existing protections and cause an application crash through a maliciously crafted file.

item.title: CVE-2024-6409|2024-07-09T17:47:47.196Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition vulnerability was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd) in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9, where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog(). This issue leaves it vulnerable to a signal handler race condition on the cleanup_exit() function, which introduces the same vulnerability as CVE-2024-6387 in the unprivileged child of the SSHD server. As a consequence of a successful attack, in the worst case scenario, the attacker may be able to perform a remote code execution (RCE) within unprivileged user running the sshd server. This vulnerability affects only the sshd server shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9, while upstream versions of sshd are not impact by this flaw.

item.title: CVE-2024-6501|2024-07-09T19:27:11.133Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in NetworkManager. When a system running NetworkManager with DEBUG logs enabled and an interface eth1 configured with LLDP enabled, a malicious user could inject a malformed LLDP packet. NetworkManager would crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-39328|2024-07-10T16:43:00.291Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in OpenJPEG similar to CVE-2019-6988. This flaw allows an attacker to bypass existing protections and cause an application crash through a maliciously crafted file.

item.title: CVE-2024-6409|2024-07-12T03:55:30.136Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A signal handler race condition vulnerability was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd) in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9, where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog(). This issue leaves it vulnerable to a signal handler race condition on the cleanup_exit() function, which introduces the same vulnerability as CVE-2024-6387 in the unprivileged child of the SSHD server. As a consequence of a successful attack, in the worst case scenario, the attacker may be able to perform a remote code execution (RCE) within unprivileged user running the sshd server. This vulnerability affects only the sshd server shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9, while upstream versions of sshd are not impact by this flaw.

item.title: CVE-2023-39329|2024-07-13T20:14:53.947Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG. A resource exhaustion can occur in the opj_t1_decode_cblks function in tcd.c through a crafted image file, causing a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-39327|2024-07-13T20:07:07.965Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG. Maliciously constructed pictures can cause the program to enter a large loop and continuously print warning messages on the terminal.

item.title: CVE-2024-6505|2024-07-13T20:15:15.670Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the virtio-net device in QEMU. When enabling the RSS feature on the virtio-net network card, the indirections_table data within RSS becomes controllable. Setting excessively large values may cause an index out-of-bounds issue, potentially resulting in heap overflow access. This flaw allows a privileged user in the guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-2467|2024-07-13T20:18:13.865Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A timing-based side-channel flaw exists in the perl-Crypt-OpenSSL-RSA package, which could be sufficient to recover plaintext across a network in a Bleichenbacher-style attack. To achieve successful decryption, an attacker would have to be able to send a large number of trial messages. The vulnerability affects the legacy PKCS#1v1.5 RSA encryption padding mode.

item.title: CVE-2024-6716|2024-07-15T15:17:48.905Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libtiff. This flaw allows an attacker to create a crafted tiff file, forcing libtiff to allocate memory indefinitely. This issue can result in a denial of service of the system consuming libtiff due to memory starvation.

item.title: CVE-2024-6716|2024-07-15T17:36:54.992Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libtiff. This flaw allows an attacker to create a crafted tiff file, forcing libtiff to allocate memory indefinitely. This issue can result in a denial of service of the system consuming libtiff due to memory starvation.

item.title: CVE-2024-6655|2024-07-16T15:05:55.424Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the GTK library. Under certain conditions, it is possible for a library to be injected into a GTK application from the current working directory.

item.title: CVE-2024-6716|2024-07-17T13:26:39.372Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the libtiff library. An out-of-memory issue in the TIFFReadEncodedStrip function can be triggered when processing a crafted tiff file, allowing attackers to perform memory allocation of arbitrary sizes, resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6716|2024-07-22T13:38:02.616Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the libtiff library. An out-of-memory issue in the TIFFReadEncodedStrip function can be triggered when processing a crafted TIFF file, allowing attackers to perform memory allocation of arbitrary sizes, resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-7409|2024-08-05T13:19:27.498Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU NBD Server. This vulnerability allows a denial of service (DoS) attack via improper synchronization during socket closure when a client keeps a socket open as the server is taken offline.

item.title: CVE-2024-7409|2024-08-06T20:17:14.655Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU NBD Server. This vulnerability allows a denial of service (DoS) attack via improper synchronization during socket closure when a client keeps a socket open as the server is taken offline.

item.title: CVE-2024-43167|2024-08-08T20:24:49.932Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the ub_ctx_set_fwd function in Unbound. This issue could allow an attacker who can invoke specific sequences of API calls to cause a segmentation fault. When certain API functions such as ub_ctx_set_fwd and ub_ctx_resolvconf are called in a particular order, the program attempts to read from a NULL pointer, leading to a crash. This issue can result in a denial of service by causing the application to terminate unexpectedly.

item.title: CVE-2024-7006|2024-08-08T20:49:45.373Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A null pointer dereference flaw was found in Libtiff via `tif_dirinfo.c`. This issue may allow an attacker to trigger memory allocation failures through certain means, such as restricting the heap space size or injecting faults, causing a segmentation fault. This can cause an application crash, eventually leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-43168|2024-08-08T20:25:24.723Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A heap-buffer-overflow flaw was found in the cfg_mark_ports function within Unbound's config_file.c, which can lead to memory corruption. This issue could allow an attacker with local access to provide specially crafted input, potentially causing the application to crash or allowing arbitrary code execution. This could result in a denial of service or unauthorized actions on the system.

item.title: CVE-2024-7006|2024-08-09T15:35:41.199Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A null pointer dereference flaw was found in Libtiff via `tif_dirinfo.c`. item.title: CVE-2024-6655|2024-08-19T16:48:17.793Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the GTK library. Under certain conditions, it is possible for a library to be injected into a GTK application from the current working directory.

item.title: CVE-2023-39329|2024-08-20T15:13:48.585Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG. A resource exhaustion can occur in the opj_t1_decode_cblks function in tcd.c through a crafted image file, causing a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-39327|2024-08-20T15:13:37.839Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG. Maliciously constructed pictures can cause the program to enter a large loop and continuously print warning messages on the terminal.

item.title: CVE-2023-39328|2024-08-20T15:13:48.012Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in OpenJPEG similar to CVE-2019-6988. This flaw allows an attacker to bypass existing protections and cause an application crash through a maliciously crafted file.

item.title: CVE-2024-5742|2024-08-20T19:12:56.109Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in GNU Nano that allows a possible privilege escalation through an insecure temporary file. If Nano is killed while editing, a file it saves to an emergency file with the permissions of the running user provides a window of opportunity for attackers to escalate privileges through a malicious symlink.

item.title: CVE-2024-43167|2024-08-20T19:28:50.910Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the ub_ctx_set_fwd function in Unbound. This issue could allow an attacker who can invoke specific sequences of API calls to cause a segmentation fault. When certain API functions such as ub_ctx_set_fwd and ub_ctx_resolvconf are called in a particular order, the program attempts to read from a NULL pointer, leading to a crash. This issue can result in a denial of service by causing the application to terminate unexpectedly.

item.title: CVE-2024-7006|2024-08-20T19:15:32.043Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A null pointer dereference flaw was found in Libtiff via `tif_dirinfo.c`. This issue may allow an attacker to trigger memory allocation failures through certain means, such as restricting the heap space size or injecting faults, causing a segmentation fault. This can cause an application crash, eventually leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-6501|2024-08-20T19:14:27.995Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in NetworkManager. When a system running NetworkManager with DEBUG logs enabled and an interface eth1 configured with LLDP enabled, a malicious user could inject a malformed LLDP packet. NetworkManager would crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-43168|2024-08-20T19:28:54.207Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A heap-buffer-overflow flaw was found in the cfg_mark_ports function within Unbound's config_file.c, which can lead to memory corruption. This issue could allow an attacker with local access to provide specially crafted input, potentially causing the application to crash or allowing arbitrary code execution. This could result in a denial of service or unauthorized actions on the system.

item.title: CVE-2024-6655|2024-08-20T19:15:02.276Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the GTK library. Under certain conditions, it is possible for a library to be injected into a GTK application from the current working directory.

item.description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the ub_ctx_set_fwd function in Unbound. This issue could allow an attacker who can invoke specific sequences of API calls to cause a segmentation fault. When certain API functions such as ub_ctx_set_fwd and ub_ctx_resolvconf are called in a particular order, the program attempts to read from a NULL pointer, leading to a crash. This issue can result in a denial of service by causing the application to terminate unexpectedly.

item.title: CVE-2024-43168|2024-08-21T04:56:34.687Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A heap-buffer-overflow flaw was found in the cfg_mark_ports function within Unbound's config_file.c, which can lead to memory corruption. This issue could allow an attacker with local access to provide specially crafted input, potentially causing the application to crash or allowing arbitrary code execution. This could result in a denial of service or unauthorized actions on the system.

item.title: CVE-2024-6501|2024-08-22T13:45:53.996Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in NetworkManager. When a system running NetworkManager with DEBUG logs enabled and an interface eth1 configured with LLDP enabled, a malicious user could inject a malformed LLDP packet. NetworkManager would crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-39327|2024-08-22T13:51:17.878Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG. Maliciously constructed pictures can cause the program to enter a large loop and continuously print warning messages on the terminal.

item.title: CVE-2024-43167|2024-08-22T15:45:19.096Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the ub_ctx_set_fwd function in Unbound. This issue could allow an attacker who can invoke specific sequences of API calls to cause a segmentation fault. When certain API functions such as ub_ctx_set_fwd and ub_ctx_resolvconf are called in a particular order, the program attempts to read from a NULL pointer, leading to a crash. This issue can result in a denial of service by causing the application to terminate unexpectedly.

item.title: CVE-2024-43168|2024-08-22T15:45:21.603Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A heap-buffer-overflow flaw was found in the cfg_mark_ports function within Unbound's config_file.c, which can lead to memory corruption. This issue could allow an attacker with local access to provide specially crafted input, potentially causing the application to crash or allowing arbitrary code execution. This could result in a denial of service or unauthorized actions on the system.

item.title: CVE-2024-6655|2024-08-22T15:13:37.692Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the GTK library. Under certain conditions, it is possible for a library to be injected into a GTK application from the current working directory.

item.title: CVE-2024-8235|2024-08-30T17:10:55.505Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libvirt. A refactor of the code fetching the list of interfaces for multiple APIs introduced a corner case on platforms where allocating 0 bytes of memory results in a NULL pointer. This corner case would lead to a NULL-pointer dereference and subsequent crash of virtinterfaced. This issue could allow clients connecting to the read-only socket to crash the virtinterfaced daemon.

item.title: CVE-2024-6655|2024-09-10T08:14:28.628Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the GTK library. Under certain conditions, it is possible for a library to be injected into a GTK application from the current working directory.

item.title: CVE-2024-5742|2024-09-17T00:12:50.171Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in GNU Nano that allows a possible privilege escalation through an insecure temporary file. If Nano is killed while editing, a file it saves to an emergency file with the permissions of the running user provides a window of opportunity for attackers to escalate privileges through a malicious symlink.

item.title: CVE-2024-2467|2024-09-17T14:32:57.951Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A timing-based side-channel flaw exists in the perl-Crypt-OpenSSL-RSA package, which could be sufficient to recover plaintext across a network in a Bleichenbacher-style attack. To achieve successful decryption, an attacker would have to be able to send a large number of trial messages. The vulnerability affects the legacy PKCS#1v1.5 RSA encryption padding mode.

item.title: CVE-2024-6505|2024-09-19T05:46:12.459Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the virtio-net device in QEMU. When enabling the RSS feature on the virtio-net network card, the indirections_table data within RSS becomes controllable. Setting excessively large values may cause an index out-of-bounds issue, potentially resulting in heap overflow access. This flaw allows a privileged user in the guest to crash the QEMU process on the host.

item.title: CVE-2024-8354|2024-09-19T13:38:51.859Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in QEMU. An assertion failure was present in the usb_ep_get() function in hw/net/core.c when trying to get the USB endpoint from a USB device. This flaw may allow a malicious unprivileged guest user to crash the QEMU process on the host and cause a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2024-8235|2024-09-20T16:03:15.107Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in libvirt. A refactor of the code fetching the list of interfaces for multiple APIs introduced a corner case on platforms where allocating 0 bytes of memory results in a NULL pointer. This corner case would lead to a NULL-pointer dereference and subsequent crash of virtinterfaced. This issue could allow clients connecting to the read-only socket to crash the virtinterfaced daemon.

item.title: CVE-2024-8612|2024-09-20T18:00:48.795Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in QEMU, in the virtio-scsi, virtio-blk, and virtio-crypto devices. The size for virtqueue_push as set in virtio_scsi_complete_req / virtio_blk_req_complete / virito_crypto_req_complete could be larger than the true size of the data which has been sent to guest. Once virtqueue_push() finally calls dma_memory_unmap to ummap the in_iov, it may call the address_space_write function to write back the data. Some uninitialized data may exist in the bounce.buffer, leading to an information leak.

item.title: CVE-2024-6501|2024-09-23T17:33:18.663Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in NetworkManager. When a system running NetworkManager with DEBUG logs enabled and an interface eth1 configured with LLDP enabled, a malicious user could inject a malformed LLDP packet. NetworkManager would crash, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-39329|2024-09-27T18:16:05.777Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG. A resource exhaustion can occur in the opj_t1_decode_cblks function in tcd.c through a crafted image file, causing a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-39328|2024-10-14T20:29:59.325Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20enterprise%20linux%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in OpenJPEG similar to CVE-2019-6988. This flaw allows an attacker to bypass existing protections and cause an application crash through a maliciously crafted file.
